p: The Caribbean Region is one of the most biologically diverse regions in the world. Because of its geographic proximity and ecological similarities to Florida, the region is a key pathway for potentially harmful exotic pests entering the United States. Despite its geographic proximity, Cuba, the largest Caribbean country and the closest large land mass to Florida, has been functionally isolated from the United States since the 1950s with the Cuban Revolution and the subsequent commercial, economic, and trade embargo. In 2000, the United States government passed the Trade Sanctions and Export Enhancement Act (TSRA) which, for the first time in nearly 40 years, allowed United States firms to sell agricultural and food products, and selected medical products to Cuba. Since the passage of TSRA, United States firms have shipped nearly $6 billion worth of food and agricultural products to Cuba and continue to sell hundreds of millions of dollars worth of goods to Cuba each year [ 16].
